title: Raiders of the Lost ARMS
body_text:
Secret Selection 3
at DODGEBALL 168:
EnduraDodgeball, Classic Rules - A Double Feature!
So how about those oxygen tanks!!? On a frigid December night like this 168th, forgetting the necessity was a sin.
Half of the warriors in attendance were eager to test their mighty endurance for a nonstop, single-game free-for-all. After about an hour of head-concussing, body-bruising bulletball shots, play switched over to the standard style of play. But don't think for a second the physical effects decreased in any way.
The WEST assaulted their no-quit adversaries in the next six straight rounds. The physical brutality was off the page. From "Cockroach" Londono nearly tearing his knee to the countless number of high-impact shots to the skull, few events pale in comparison to this massacre.
Flash Results by Game
EAST: (0)
WEST: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
*Classic Rules only
The Rules
: Game 1 featured
EnduraDodgeball
. Games 2 through 7 were classic two-team.
The Match
: The EAST fought The WEST to a 0-0 draw under
EnduraDodgeball
rules; The WEST defeated The EAST, 6 - 0, under classic two-team.
(see
DODGEBALL 156
)
Moments & Stars
: Mike "Sputz" Krott's inability to find a bulletball directly in front of him; the heated "previews" of next week's Fitzpatrick-Wolf clash; Bobby Vetrano and John Tronolone cheaply blocking with the rims
Attendance
: 18, comprised of 13 men and 5 women. This was the record-breaking fourth time this season where an overall attendance reached 18.
Familiar Faces
included explosive superstar Grant Cornero, as well as nice surprise visits from Ryan McCrorey, Kelsey Clayton,  and spectator Bethany Schonberg.
Other Notes
: The third
Secret Selection
produced a tie between
Endura
and Classic rules. Thus, both were featured gametypes of DODGEBALL 168.
Secret Selection 3
Results
Endura
: 6 Votes
BoxBall
: 2 Votes
Classic Rules: 6 Votes
*The unnamed Chris Adams-created "SuperMario" Dodgeball was taken off the list due to lack of equipment.
History:
DODGEBALL 108
..
DODGEBALL 124
"The Writer" Was Lazy Then Too
DODGEBALL 168 did not have an official logo. Coincidently, DODGEBALL 68 in December 2006 did not have a poster to go with it either. Hmmm, who the hell knows sometimes!
________________________________________
_________
And Then There Were Two ...
Season 17 Double Main Event!
DODGEBALL 169: 3rd Annual Holiday Special on December 20!
Two of the meanest, baddest animals to ever grace the hallowed dodgeball battlegrounds will go face-to-face in this special attraction. For the first time ever, it's
Justin Wolf
against
Kevin Fitzpatrick
and there isn't any doubt this one will get nasty in a hurry.
DODGEBALL 170: Season 17 Finale on December 27 at 6pm!
And here it is, the long-awaited encounter between David and Goliath. "Legend Killer"
Michelle Mullins
faces undoubtedly her toughest, biggest obstacle ever in the iconic catching monster
Michael "Sputz" Krott
. Will the Rookie-of-the-Year contender silence the beast that stands in front of her? Or will the monster himself mercilessly stomp his opposition into oblivion? The only way to find out is to attend - action begins at 6pm!
body_html:
Secret Selection 3 at DODGEBALL 168:
EnduraDodgeball, Classic Rules - A Double Feature!

So how about those oxygen tanks!!? On a frigid December night like this 168th, forgetting the necessity was a sin.

Half of the warriors in attendance were eager to test their mighty endurance for a nonstop, single-game free-for-all. After about an hour of head-concussing, body-bruising bulletball shots, play switched over to the standard style of play. But don't think for a second the physical effects decreased in any way.

The WEST assaulted their no-quit adversaries in the next six straight rounds. The physical brutality was off the page. From "Cockroach" Londono nearly tearing his knee to the countless number of high-impact shots to the skull, few events pale in comparison to this massacre.

Flash Results by Game
EAST: (0)
WEST: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
*Classic Rules only

The Rules: Game 1 featured EnduraDodgeball. Games 2 through 7 were classic two-team.
The Match: The EAST fought The WEST to a 0-0 draw under EnduraDodgeball rules; The WEST defeated The EAST, 6 - 0, under classic two-team. (see DODGEBALL 156)
Moments & Stars: Mike "Sputz" Krott's inability to find a bulletball directly in front of him; the heated "previews" of next week's Fitzpatrick-Wolf clash; Bobby Vetrano and John Tronolone cheaply blocking with the rims
Attendance: 18, comprised of 13 men and 5 women. This was the record-breaking fourth time this season where an overall attendance reached 18.
Familiar Faces included explosive superstar Grant Cornero, as well as nice surprise visits from Ryan McCrorey, Kelsey Clayton, and spectator Bethany Schonberg.
Other Notes: The third Secret Selection produced a tie between Endura and Classic rules. Thus, both were featured gametypes of DODGEBALL 168.

Secret Selection 3 Results
Endura: 6 Votes
BoxBall: 2 Votes
Classic Rules: 6 Votes
*The unnamed Chris Adams-created "SuperMario" Dodgeball was taken off the list due to lack of equipment.
  • History: DODGEBALL 108 .. DODGEBALL 124

    "The Writer" Was Lazy Then Too
    DODGEBALL 168 did not have an official logo. Coincidently, DODGEBALL 68 in December 2006 did not have a poster to go with it either. Hmmm, who the hell knows sometimes!

    _________________________________________________

    And Then There Were Two ...
    Season 17 Double Main Event!

    DODGEBALL 169: 3rd Annual Holiday Special on December 20!
    Two of the meanest, baddest animals to ever grace the hallowed dodgeball battlegrounds will go face-to-face in this special attraction. For the first time ever, it's Justin Wolf against Kevin Fitzpatrick and there isn't any doubt this one will get nasty in a hurry.

    DODGEBALL 170: Season 17 Finale on December 27 at 6pm!
    And here it is, the long-awaited encounter between David and Goliath. "Legend Killer" Michelle Mullins faces undoubtedly her toughest, biggest obstacle ever in the iconic catching monster Michael "Sputz" Krott. Will the Rookie-of-the-Year contender silence the beast that stands in front of her? Or will the monster himself mercilessly stomp his opposition into oblivion? The only way to find out is to attend - action begins at 6pm!
